name: A. Gabriel and Caterpillar
statement:
The -th grade student Gabriel noticed a caterpillar on a tree when
walking around in a forest after the classes. The caterpillar was on the
height cm from the ground. On the height cm () on the same tree hung an
apple and the caterpillar was crawling to the apple.Gabriel is
interested when the caterpillar gets the apple. He noted that the
caterpillar goes up by cm per hour by day and slips down by cm per hour
by night.In how many days Gabriel should return to the forest to see the
caterpillar get the apple. You can consider that the day starts at am
and finishes at pm. Gabriel’s classes finish at pm. You can consider
that Gabriel noticed the caterpillar just after the classes at pm.Note
that the forest is magic so the caterpillar can slip down under the
ground and then lift to the apple.
editorial:
The problem was suggested by unprost. Letâs consider three cases. in
this case the caterpillar will get the apple on the same day, so the
answer is . The first condition is false and in this case the
caterpillar will never get the apple, because it canât do that on the
first day and after each night it will be lower than one day before. If
the first two conditions are false easy to see that the answer equals to
. C++ solution
